intro: Maxillaria linearis, commonly known as the linear orchid, is a species native to Central and South America. It is a terrestrial orchid characterized by its slender, erect stems and linear, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces fragrant, white to pale pink flowers with prominent, hairy sepals and petals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Maxillaria linearis is appreciated for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by orchid enthusiasts.
